bibl.title: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, February 24, 1915

div1.p: Blue directs Carter to inspect the waters around the Georgia-Carolina Power Plant.

div1.head: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, February 24, 1915
div1.opener:
JKC
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
February 24, 1915.
WMT
Senior Surgeon Henry R. Carter,
U. S. Public Health Service,
Baltimore, Maryland.
Sir:
div1.p:
Referring to Bureau order dated January 26, 1915,
directing you to proceed to certain places in South
Carolina to make an investigation of conditions caused
by the impounding of waters by the Parr Shoals Hydro-
Electric Company, you are directed, in connection with
this work, to visit the Georgia-Carolina Power Plant
for the same purpose.

Your status while carrying out this order will be
that of special temporary duty.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, Rupert Blue
Surgeon-General.
The expenses incurred in carrying out the foregoing
instructions are hereby authorized.
B R Newton
Assistant Secretary.
R B
✓
